intro: Canthium inaequilaterum, commonly known as the unequal-sided spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often asymmetrical, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
